remarks: Initial objects are essentially unique (weak form), i.e. if A and B are initial objects, then A and B are isomorphic.  Proposition 7.3 (1) of [Adamek] p. 102.  (Contributed by AV, 6-Apr-2020.)
statement:
initoeu1.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
initoeu1.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( InitO ` C ) ) $.
initoeu1.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( InitO ` C ) ) $.
initoeu1w $p |- ( ph -> A ( ~=c ` C ) B ) $.
